lead_paragraph: The New York City comptroller, who has also served in the State Assembly and as Manhattan borough president, appears to be shopping for a new team of political consultants.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and J. DAVID GOODMAN

headline.print_headline: Without Saying He Will Challenge the Mayor, Stringer Still Has Plenty to Say
headline.main: Without Saying He’ll Challenge Mayor de Blasio, Scott Stringer Still Says Plenty

snippet: The New York City comptroller, who has also served in the State Assembly and as Manhattan borough president, appears to be shopping for a new team of political consultants....
abstract: New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer continues to insist has no plans to run for mayor in 2017, but he has not stopped voicing his poor opinions about effectiveness of Mayor Bill de Blasio; political strategists say continuing stream of verbal attacks signals that Stringer is testing waters, showing potential donors he is looking to challenge de Blasio.
